column4: How would I use STDIN but not from a file. So like echo < "I want you to use this data

2008-06-23T05:16:00.000Z	MeVsTheVoices		But have it not interpret that as a filename
2008-06-23T05:18:00.000Z	Flannel	MeVsTheVoices	echo blah blah blah" | program
Is there an easy way in bash to dissassosciate a process?
What do you mean by disassociate?
robf: you want to map twice.  hd0 to hd1 and hd1 to hd0 (or whatever the real numbers are), or else you wind up with two hd0s, etc.  Not happy.
Should use $(), its a bigger pain, bt faster argument passing
Do you really have nothing better to do than whine at my cusslings?
If you just follow the rules in the first place, I won't have to meddle.
What says you have to meddle?
Little bit slow on that one
One of these days your gonna slip
